questions.question: In “Thank You, M’am,” what theme is the author, Langston Hughes, exploring?

choices.answer: the importance of hard work for all
the threat of crime against the old
the difficulties of poverty for the young
the importance of honesty and trust

questions.question: Why does Roger attempt to steal Mrs. Jones’s handbag?

choices.answer: He is a criminal, and Mrs. Jones looks like easy prey.
He wants to buy himself a pair of blue suede shoes.
He is hungry and needs her money to buy food.
He wants to give the money as a gift to his own mother.

questions.question: What can the reader assume about Mrs. Jones’s life as a younger woman?

choices.answer: She had worked hard all of her life
She had raised her own sons well.
She had made mistakes in the past.
She had often been arrested.

questions.question: "What does the following sentence mean: "“He did not trust the woman not to trust him”?

choices.answer: Roger doesn’t entirely trust Mrs. Jones at this time.
Roger wants her to see that he can be trusted.
Roger knows that he isn’t trustworthy.
Roger needs to see what Mrs. Jones is doing

questions.question: What does the author mean by "shoes got by devilish ways will burn your feet"?

choices.answer: It means that the shoes won't fit his feet.
It means that the shoes will burn his feet.
It means that the shoes will be ugly.
If you steal money to buy shoes, guilt will burn your feet.

questions.question: Why does Roger sit on the far side of the room when Mrs. Jones goes behind the screen?

choices.answer: He isfrightened she is phoning the police.
He does not want to smell the food she is cooking
He wantsher to see that he isn't stealing from her purse.
He wants to hide behind the screen so he can steal her money

questions.question: Which idea does the theme of “Thank you, Ma’am” deal with?

choices.answer: the value of kindness
the value of hard work
the value of a dollar
the value of city life

questions.question: We can infer that Roger is poor or had no one to really watch over him because

choices.answer: his hair was not combed
his face was dirty.
he was trying to steal.
all the answers are correct

questions.question: Why is Roger scared at first in Mrs. Jones' home?

choices.answer: He is very hungry.
Mrs. Jones is a strong, large woman.
She talks so fast that he can't understandher.
He fears that she will turn him over to thepolice.

questions.question: What happens when Roger tries to steal Mrs. Jones's purse in "Thank You, M'am"?

choices.answer: He changes his mind because he knows stealing is wrong.
He changes his mind because he is frightened
The purse is so heavy that he loses his balance and falls.
He runs away but is caught by another person

questions.question: Mrs. Jones (–).

choices.answer: lives with her family
has known Roger for many years
never goes out at night
works in a beauty shop

questions.question: What do we learn about Roger at the beginning of the story?

choices.answer: He always starts fights with people.
He wants to steal a pocketbook
He likes to take walks at night.
He has no friends.

questions.question: Mrs. Jones says to Roger, "Everybody's got something in common." What do they have in common?

choices.answer: They both want to change their lives
They both have done something wrong.
They both like people.
They are both afraid of the police.

questions.question: What is unusual about Mrs. Jones' behavior in this story? She (–).

choices.answer: gives Roger money
invites Roger to visit her again
asks Roger for help
sends Roger to the store

questions.question: When Mrs. Jones takes Roger to her house, she (-).

choices.answer: gives him a pair of shoes
calls the police
gives him a meal
tells him to fix her purse

questions.question: “The large woman simply turned around and kicked him right square in his blue-jeaned sitter.”

choices.answer: She is puzzled.
She is frightened.
She is angry.
She is deeply hurt.

questions.question: Why does Roger go with Mrs. Jones to her apartment in the first place?

choices.answer: Because she invited him to her house for dinner.
They have been friends for years.
She promises to give him money for a pair of shoes.
She drags him there against his will.

questions.question: How does Mrs. Jones show she trusts Roger?

choices.answer: She makes him wash his face.
She makes sure neighbors keep their doors open.
She leaves her purse near him when she prepares food.
She tells him her full name.

questions.question: According to Mrs. Jones in “Thank You, Ma'am,” what lesson has Roger not been taught?

choices.answer: the difference between right and wrong
why “early to bed and early to rise” is true
how to steal a purse without getting caught
how to apologize

questions.question: The author calls Mrs. Jones “a large woman.” What might large apply to besides her size?

choices.answer: her large amount of money
her large heart
her large number of friends
her large temper

questions.question: The conflict of person vs. person in the story specifically refers to:

choices.answer: Roger and his conscience
Mrs. Jones and her past.
Mrs. Jones and Roger
Roger and his choices.

questions.question: When Mrs. Jones reveals her past she is considered what type of character?

choices.answer: Dynamic
Static
Round
Flat

questions.question: “The large woman simply turned around and kicked him right-square in his blue-jeaned sitter."

choices.answer: Mrs. Jones is kind- SPEECH
Mrs. Jones is strong- ACTION
Mrs. Jones is weak- EFFECT ON OTHERS
Mrs. Jones is not bothered by anything- APPEARANCE

questions.question: Roger has nobody at home at his house

choices.answer: Internal Conflict
External Conflict

questions.question: Roger does not want to be mistrusted after he tried to steal Mrs. Jones's purse & she was kind.

choices.answer: Internal Conflict
External Conflict
